Comment: “three” (lit. “once two and once without the other one”)
“four” (this expression was only attested once and the etymology is not known)
“five” (lit. “two two and once without the other one”)

Value: tʃinĩkaj 'kə̃ “more than five (e.g. seven)” (lit. “(our) fingers are finished”
